response.answer_text: Hell yea it is. There’s nothing about poetry that isn’t creative. In fact, I would venture to say that poetry is THE creative writing format. Each person writes poetry differently, even if they’re imitating a style. Poetry doesn’t just incorporate words and story structure like short stories do, poetry can bring emotions and smart usage of analogies to the table. It’s brilliant and beautiful because it’s from the heart, even when it’s based off of a prompt given by a teacher or something. That’s my two cents…

What else would it be? You created a literary piece of art (no matter if it is actually good or will appeal to anyone or not) where there wasn’t one before. It’s as just as creative as fiction or even essay writing.
